intro: Tetragonanthus multiflorus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and thrives in bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Tetragonanthus multiflorus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
